intro: Elytranthe lifuensis, commonly known as the Lifuensis sunstar, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. Elytranthe lifuensis is notable for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity.
